title: Gazza trial: Paul Gascoigne cleared of sexually assaulting woman he kissed on a train
text:
Paul Gascoigne has been cleared of sexually assaulting a woman he kissed on the train.

The jury was sent out on Wednesday to consider its verdict in the trial of former football star known as Gazza, who was accused of sexual assault after forcefully kissing a woman on the lips.

The 52-year-old ex-England midfielder denied the offence, saying it was not sexual, and that he kissed the stranger to boost her confidence after he heard someone call her fat.

The jury agreed with Gascoigne, but the jury is still considering an alternative charge of assault by beating.

Teesside Crown Court heard the complainant was on a York to Newcastle train in August 2018 when Gascoigne, who was loud and swearing, drunkenly sat down next to her, tapped her on the arm, grabbed her by the cheeks and planted a sloppy kiss on her lips.

In her closing speech to the jury Michelle Heeley QC, defending, told jurors the former footballer kissed a woman who was not expecting it and did not like it, but that did not make him a sex offender.

Speaking about the alternative charge, she said: "You may think, 14 months after this incident, this is really a sexual assault, or nothing."
description: Paul Gascoigne has been cleared of sexually assaulting a woman he kissed on the train.
